Trust & verification

Transparency is the foundation of our directory. We maintain strict vetting standards and aggregate multi-platform review data to ensure you can choose a locksmith with confidence. Verification is independent of any paid promotion.

Contents

Verification Checks Badge Definitions Review Aggregation Complaints & Removals FAQs

Verification checks we perform

Identity & Business

We verify legal business names and ownership status against Companies House data or sole trader documentation to ensure the entity exists.

Contact Validation

We confirm physical business addresses and verify active phone connectivity to prevent "ghost" listings.

Professional Credentials

We cross-reference trade memberships (e.g., Master Locksmiths Association) and validate current public liability insurance documentation.

Safety Checks

We verify DBS (Disclosure and Barring Service) certificates where a locksmith has opted for this specific badge, ensuring recent criminal record checks are clean.

Badges and what they represent

Verified Listing

Identity and business details (address, ownership, and phone) have been manually checked by our internal verification team.

DBS Checked

A valid criminal record certificate (basic or enhanced) has been sighted and logged by our team within the last 12 months.

MLA Member

An active membership to the Master Locksmiths Association has been confirmed via the MLA directory.

Insured

Public Liability insurance documents have been submitted and verified as active at the time of onboarding.

Please Note: Verification represents a check performed at a specific point in time. It does not constitute a guarantee of future service outcome or a personal endorsement of the locksmith's nextuality.

How reviews and ratings work

We provide a 360-degree view of a provider's reputation by aggregating ratings from our directory and external authority platforms.

Directory Reviews

Original feedback submitted directly to our platform by verified customers. Each review is moderated for spam, profanity, and policy compliance before publication.

External Profiles

Real-time data synchronized from major third-party profiles, including Google Business Profiles, Checkatrade, and Trustpilot. We do not filter this data; we display the current public average.

Disclaimer: We strive not to interfere as an intermediary in third-party sites. Ratings or reviews may not always represent the most recent update.

Complaints, suspensions, and removals

We take reports of misconduct seriously. Our team investigates all formal complaints regarding listed locksmiths.

  • A listing may be hidden during an active investigation of a serious report involving safety or legality.
  • Providers who fail to meet ongoing trust standards, lack valid insurance, or are found to be operating fraudulently are removed permanently and assigned a 410 (Gone) status.
Report a concern

Trust and verification FAQs

Can a locksmith pay to be verified?

No. Verification is an entirely safety-and-identity check that cannot be bypassed or purchased. While providers may pay for increased visibility via promoted listings, they must pass our standard vetting process first.

Do promoted listings skip checks?

Absolutely not. Promoted listings undergo the same rigorous verification process. Promotion only affects placement in search results, not the trustworthiness standards we require.

How often are checks repeated?

Identity and insurance documentation is re-verified annually. DBS certificates are checked every 12 months from the date of issue. We may conduct spot checks at any time if we receive reports or notice irregularities.

What happens if a locksmith fails a check?

If a locksmith cannot provide valid documentation or fails to meet our verification standards, their listing is immediately suspended. They are given an opportunity to rectify the issue within 14 days. If they cannot, the listing is permanently removed.
